thread.title: Florida female bowlers: Pay attention to state, national tournament deadlines
thread.title_full: Florida female bowlers: Pay attention to state, national tournament deadlines | Examiner.com

author: Bill Herald
title: Florida female bowlers: Pay attention to state, national tournament deadlines
text:
Examiner.com provides information on upcoming women's state and national tournaments. bowling300.com Female bowlers from the Sarasota-Manatee County area and throughout Florida should be aware of the women's-only state and national tournaments available during the 2015-16 season.
The entry deadlines are fast approaching for two of the annual events: the Florida Senior Doubles & Singles state tournament in Lakeland, and the Florida 600 Club's state tourney in Leesburg.
Entries into the state senior event must be filed no later than Oct. 15, and the reserved 600 Club closing date is Wednesday (Oct. 7).
Following are capsule summaries of each tournament, accompanied by links that will allow easy access to downloading or printing official entry blanks. Complete rules and full information are included on those forms.
2015 Florida women's senior state tourney
Orange Bowl Lanes in Lakeland will host the women's senior state event on the weekends of Nov. 7-8 and Nov. 14-15. Competition is open to members of the Florida State Women's Bowling Association who are age 50 or up as of the Oct. 15 closing date.
Singles will be contested in two age categories -- Division 1 (50-64) and Division 2 (65-up) -- while doubles will be in a single classification, and partners need not be in the same age classification.
Entry fee is $18 per woman per event, plus a $2 optional all-events cost. Saturday squads will be at 10 a.m for doubles and 2 p.m. for singles, while Sunday doubles and singles squads will be at 9 a.m. and 1 p.m., respectively.
Re-entries will not be permitted, and handicap will be 100 percent of 210. To download or view the entry blank, click here . And for map and lodging information, click here .
2016 Florida women's state tournament
The annual women's state championships will be conducted in the Melbourne area for five consecutive weekends, beginning May 14-15, with four-player team competition at Shore Lanes in Palm Bay and singles and doubles at Brunswick Harbor Lanes in Melbourne.
Entry fee is $25 per woman per event, plus optional scratch entries at $5 per event, and scratch and handicap all-events available at $5 each. Entries received no later than Feb. 1 will pay regular fees, but after that (until March 1), an additional $20 late fee will be assessed.
Competition will be in one division, and handicap is 100 percent of 220. Squad times will be at 9 a.m. and 2 p.m. for each of the tournament dates. To view or download an official entry blank, click here .
Florida Women's 600 Club's state tournament
The 59th annual Florida 600 Club tournament will be held at Leesburg Lanes in Leesburg on the weekend of Oct. 17-18, with Saturday squads at 11 a.m. and 2 p.m. and a single Sunday squad at noon.
Reserved entries will close on Wednesday (Oct. 7), but walk-ins will be accepted. Entry fee for the three-game singles -- contested in five classified scratch divisions -- is $23, plus an optional $7 for a simultaneous handicap (90 percent of 220) competition. There will also be a 3-6-9 Friendship Doubles event with an entry fee of $20 per team.
For a link to a Web site from which you can view or download an official tournament entry blank, click here .
62nd annual St. Petersburg Women's Classic
This always-popular tournament will be conducted on the weekends of Nov. 14-15 and 21-22., and the entry deadline is Nov. 5. The event is open to all female members of the United States Bowling Congress.
The four-player team event will be conducted at Ten Pin Lanes in South Pasadena, with doubles and singles at Seminole Lanes in Seminole. Entry fee is $24 per woman per event, with an optional all-events fee of $10, and handicap will be 100 percent of 210. In addition, optional scratch competition is available at $10 per event, including all-events.
To view or download an official tournament entry blank, which includes rules, squad times and all pertinent information, click here .
2016 USBC Women's Championships in Las Vegas
The world's largest participatory sporting event for women will be conducted in Las Vegas, Nev., from April 9 through July 10, with more than 15,000 female members of the United States Bowling Congress competing.
The Women's Open is a multi-division handicap tournament, with four average categories in team event and six divisions in singles, doubles and all-events. Prizes will also be awarded for the top overall scratch scores.
Entry fee is $44 per woman per event, plus an optional $8 for all-events, and reservation closing date is Dec. 15. For a direct link to complete tournament information -- including rules, registration, travel, past results and much more -- click here .
